title: Carlos Fuentes - Novels & Short Stories (13 books)
description:
CARLOS FUENTES (1928-2012) was a Mexican novelist and essayist.  In his obituary, the New York Times described him as "one of the most admired writers in the Spanish-speaking world" and an important influence on the Latin American boom, the explosion of Latin American literature in the 1960s-70s, while The Guardian called him "Mexico's most celebrated novelist".

His many literary honors included the Miguel de Cervantes Prize as well as Mexico's highest award, the Belisario DomÃƒÂ­nguez Medal of Honor.  He was often named as a likely candidate for the Nobel Prize in Literature, though he never won.  His work has been translated into 24 languages.


Unless otherwise noted, the following books are in EPUB/MOBI format:

* A CHANGE OF SKIN (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1968).  Translated by Sam Hileman.  [PDF]

* ADAM IN EDEN (Dalkey Archive, 2012).  Translated by E. Swaskan Bumas and Alejandro Branger.

* AURA [Bilingual Edition] (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1986).  Translated by Lysander Kemp.

* THE CRYSTAL FRONTIER: A NOVEL IN NINE STORIES (Bloomsbury, 1998).  Translated by Alfred Mac Adam.

* THE DEATH OF ARTEMIO CRUZ (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1991).  Translated by Alfred Mac Adam.  [EPUB / MOBI / PDF]

* DESTINY AND DESIRE (Random House, 2011).  Translated by Edith Grossman.

* DIANA: THE GODDESS WHO HUNTS ALONE (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1995).  Translated by Alfred Mac Adam.

* THE EAGLE'S THRONE (Random House, 2006).  Translated by Kristina Cordero.

* HAPPY FAMILIES: STORIES (Random House, 2008).  Translated by Edith Grossman.

* INEZ (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 2002).  Translated by Margaret Sayers Peden.

* TERRA NOSTRA (Dalkey Archive, 2003).  Translated by Margaret Sayers Peden; Introduction by Jorge Volpi; Afterword by Milan Kundera.  [PDF]

* THIS I BELIEVE: AN A TO Z OF A LIFE (Random House, 2005).  Translated by Kristina Cordero.

* THE YEARS WITH LAURA DIAZ (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 2000).  Translated by Alfred Mac Adam.
